thoughts.content:
# Book 1 Why bother? An Intro

- Three essential facets of the path to enlightenment: listen, contemplate, meditate
- “…not a religion, but a set of highly effective, proven methods for improving my mind” - Rinpoche
- Blind faith is the least kind - my journey had to start in this very specific moment in my life because I now have the experience to understand it
- One does not have to forsake their existing belief system; they are intrinsically Buddhist in the grand scheme of things.
- The Dalai Lama believes that most people should seek enlightenment in the path of their own people but for some other people’s paths are more effective for them

Why I bothered…

- Earthseed
- Riusseau’s wilderness
- Melancholic longing, existential loneliness
- This reminds me of “hole in our souls” that all addicts struggle to fill
- Wrong foundations for society
- Guide through the coming “Earth change”
- Prodigal Son moment
- Baha’i prayers claimed her mind
- “the Mystery” - Rabbi Herman Schaalman
- “changing channels”
- “the soup”
- She had a long winding path and sudden shock to her paradigm that spurred her to pursue a spiritual path.
